bucket_backend.description: Specifies the database backend to use for storage, with an option for default (represented by an empty string), 'mongodb', or 'influxdb'.
bucket_backend.title: Bucket Backend

bucket_config.description: Configuration schema for a data bucket specifying how data is sourced and updated. This schema supports multiple source types including devices and MQTT topics, each with its own set of required properties.

oneOf.description: Configuration for data sourced from a device. This requires specifying the device, user, resource, update interval, and optional tags.

device.description: The unique identifier for the device.

interval.description: The time between updates, in seconds.

resource.description: The specific resource from the device being tracked.

source.description: Indicates the data source is a device.

tags.description: A collection of tags for categorization, limited to 5.

update.description: Specifies that the bucket is updated at regular intervals.

user.description: The unique identifier for the user associated with this bucket.

oneOf.description: Configuration for data sourced from a device with event-based or no updates. This variation does not require an interval.

device.description: The unique identifier for the device.

resource.description: The specific resource from the device being tracked.

source.description: Indicates the data source is a device.

tags.description: A collection of tags for categorization, limited to 5.

update.description: Specifies how the bucket is updated: either by specific events or not updated automatically.

user.description: The unique identifier for the user associated with this bucket.

oneOf.description: Configuration for data sourced from an MQTT topic. This requires specifying the topic and allows optional tags.

source.description: Indicates the data source is an MQTT topic.

tags.description: A collection of tags for categorization, limited to 5.

topic.description: The MQTT topic from which data is sourced.

oneOf.description: Configuration for data manually written or provided via an API. This variation only requires source specification and allows optional tags.

source.description: Indicates the data source is either manually written ('write') or sourced via an API ('api').

tags.description: A collection of tags for categorization, limited to 5.

bucket_config.title: Bucket Config

bucket_retention.description: Configuration schema for data bucket retention policy.

period.description: The duration of the retention period. 0 for unlimited retention.

unit.description: The unit of measurement for the retention period.

bucket_retention.title: Bucket Retention

product_conditional_icon.description: Conditional Icon schema for a product
product_conditional_icon.title: Product Conditional Icon

projects_ids.description: A collection of unique project IDs, ensuring no duplicates within the array.

items.description: An array of unique project identifiers, each following a 'username@project' format with each part limited to 32 alphanumeric characters, underscores or hyphens.
items.title: Project IDs

projects_ids.title: Projects IDs Array

resource_description.description: A brief description of the resource, providing context or additional information, limited to 255 characters.
resource_description.title: Resource Description

resource_id.description: A unique identifier for resources, consisting of alphanumeric characters, underscores, or hyphens, and limited to 32 characters.
resource_id.title: Resource ID

resource_name.description: The name of the resource, limited to 255 characters. It can include any character.
resource_name.title: Resource Name

Email.description: Creates an endpoint that sends an email when called. The calling data can be used in the body or the subject using placeholders like {{temperature}}.

HTTP Request.description: Creates an endpoint that resend the call JSON data to the target endpoint, both from api or device calls. The calling data can be used in the url or headers using placeholders like {{temperature}}.

HTTP Request Custom Body.description: Creates an endpoint that composes a new paylaod with the source variables passed to the call, both from api or device calls. The calling data can be used in the body, url, or headers using placeholders like {{temperature}}.

Email.description: Creates an endpoint that sends an email when called. The calling data can be used in the body or the subject using placeholders like {{temperature}}.

HTTP Request.description: Creates an endpoint that resend the call JSON data to the target endpoint, both from api or device calls. The calling data can be used in the url or headers using placeholders like {{temperature}}.

HTTP Request Custom Body.description: Creates an endpoint that composes a new paylaod with the source variables passed to the call, both from api or device calls. The calling data can be used in the body, url, or headers using placeholders like {{temperature}}.

Create Storage.description: Creates a new file storage with public access. It can act as a web server and it is possible to serve a default file, i.e., index.html
Creates a new file storage with public access. It can act as a web server and it is possible to serve a default file, i.e., index.html

Admin Access.description: Creates a token with admin access. (For every resource, with any name, execute any action).

Custom Access.description: Creates a token with permissions for reading an specific bucket 'mqtt_bucket', and to access any device resource.

Admin Access.description: Creates a token with admin access. (For every resource, with any name, execute any action).

Custom Access.description: Creates a token with permissions for reading an specific bucket 'mqtt_bucket', and to access any device resource.
